tags.name: alert management
tags.description: Provides operations to get, search for and perform actions on alerts.

tags.name: predefinitions
tags.description: Provides operations to get supported predefined codes for use as reason codes and message codes.

get.summary: Get a URI to download file attachment.
get.description: Operation to create a URI pointing to the binary content of the file attachment identified by the given `attachmentId`.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Id of file attachment create download URI for

404.description: Attachment or associated alert not found

get.summary: Get a paginated, sorted list of bulk job status.
get.description:
Allows clients to obtain a list of jobs they have submitted. Unless specified otherwise via `sortKey` and `sortOrder`,
results are sorted in submission order (by `submittedAt`, oldest first).

get.summary: Get the processing status and -- if completed -- the individual item results for a bulk job.
get.description:
Bulk operations are asynchronous, upon submission, the system returns a `jobId` that represents the submitted job. With
this operation, clients can obtain the processing status and job results, given a `jobId`.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The `jobId` as obtained from the response of one of the bulk operations, or from the response of `getBulkJobs`.

post.summary: Adds a new comment to all alerts identified by the given alert ids.
post.description: This is an asynchronous operation, the given request is queued to be processed later. Use operation `getBulkJobStatus` to check the processing status and to retrieve the results.

202.description: Indicates that initial validations passed and the request was queued successfully.

get.summary: Get legal `key` - `filterType` combinations that can be used when filtering for alerts.
get.description: Returns the list of filter and sort keys that can be used when filtering for alerts. `alias` is the value that can be used as the sort/filter key, `filterTypes` lists the allowed filter operations.

post.summary: Get a paginated, sorted list of alerts matching the specified filters
post.description: Applies the given filter conditions, sorting and paging to produce a page of matching alerts.

400.description: Invalid filter (e.g. unknown sort/filter key, value or invalid filterType)

put.summary: Change the investigation status of all alerts identified by the given alert ids.
put.description: Indicates that initial validations passed and the request was queued successfully.

202.description: Indicates that initial validations passed and the request was queued successfully.

get.summary: Get a paginated, sorted list of alerts without applying any filter conditions.
get.description: Request for getting all alerts available for the requesting user without the need for sending a body.

400.description: Invalid page request (e.g. unknown sort key or invalid sorting)

put.summary: Change the status of all alerts identified by the given alert ids.
put.description: This is an asynchronous operation, the given request is queued to be processed later. Use operation `getBulkJobStatus` to check the processing status and to retrieve the results.

202.description: Indicates that initial validations passed and the request was queued successfully.

get.summary: Returns the full alert details for the alert with the given `alertId`.
get.description: Operation that returns an alert for the given `alertId`. Depending on the permission configuration of the calling client, only a subset of the available attributes may be returned.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert to be retrieved.

post.summary: Add file attachments to the alert with the given `alertId`.
post.description: Operation for adding up to five attachments to an alert. A comment indicating that attachments were added will be created and associatd with the attachments.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert to which the attachments should be added

400.description:
More than five attachments, duplicate file names, a file name with more than 100 characters or an unsupported file type is used (supported:
csv, doc, docx, gif, jpe, jpeg, jpg, msg, pdf, png, txt, xls, xlsx, zip

200.description: Attachment(s) were uploaded successfully. The response contains the generated comment.

get.summary: Get a paginated, sorted list of comments associated with the alert identified by the given `alertId`.
get.description: Operation to get a page of comments associated with the given alert. Comments can be sorted by creation timestamp using `sortKey = 'commentTimestamp'`.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert for which comments should be retrieved

post.summary: Add a new comment to the alert with the given `alertId`.
post.description: Operation for adding a comment to an alert. Up to 5 file attachments can be specified to be uploaded as well.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert to which the comment should be added

400.description: Invalid message code or or other request validation failure.

put.summary: Change the investigation status of the alert with the given `alertId`.
put.description: Performs an investigation status transition on the alert.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert to be changed.

409.description: Alert is currently part of a batch process and therefore locked

put.summary: Change the status of the alert with the given `alertId`.
put.description: Performs a status transition on the alert.

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The id of the alert to be changed.

409.description: Alert is currently part of a batch process and therefore locked

400.description: Invalid target status, invalid reason code or other request validation failure.

get.summary: Get list of all predefined message codes for use when adding comments to alerts (`addCommentToAlert`).
get.description:
Operation for getting all predefined message codes available in the system. The `audience` defines which stakeholder groups are allowed to use the respective code.
Users of this API are only allowed to use message codes where the audience is either `ALL` or `NATIONAL`, and where `usable` is `true`.

get.summary: Get list of all predefined reason codes to use when performing alert status changes (`changeAlertStatus`).
get.description:
Operation for getting all predefined reason codes available in the system. The `audience` defines which stakeholder groups are allowed to use the respective code.
Users of this API are only allowed to use reason codes where the audience is either `ALL` or `NATIONAL`, and where `usable` is `true`. Additionally, `excludedStatuses` may optionally define a list of alert statuses where the respective code cannot be used to transition an alert into that status.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

modifiedBy.description: Username of NAMS user who most recently modified this record.

modifiedAt.description: The time at which this record was most recently modified.

alertId.description: Unique identifier of the alert. Used across all participating systems to refer to _this_ alert.

locationId.description: Unique identifier of the _location_ (a particular pharmacy or hospital, for example) where the alert was raised. The value is usually generated by the national system.

causerUserName.description: The name of the user that caused the alert.

causerSubUserId.description: The sub user id given by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

errorCodeHub.description: The error code specifying the reason for this alert given by the European Hub.

errorMessageHub.description: The error message given by the European Hub, describing the `errorCodeHub`.

initiatingMarket.description: The country code of the country where the alert-raising transaction was initiated in. This is usually the country where the affected pack is located.

fulfillingMarket.description: The country code of the country where the national system is located that escalated the alert. Can be equal to `initiatingMarket` if the alert-raising transaction was a local one, i.e. _not_ an inter-market transaction.

requestTargetState.description: In the case of a (undo) decommission transaction, specifies the desired target pack state of the alert-raising transaction.

alertTimestamp.description: Timestamp at which the alert was raised.

escalationTimestamp.description: Timestamp at which the alert will be or would have been automatically escalated. Automatic escalation is performed when alerts are not being worked on by NAMS users.

givenProductCodeScheme.description: The product code scheme specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenProductCode.description: The product code specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenBatchId.description: The batch id specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenBatchExpiryDate.description: The batch expiry date specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenSerialNumber.description: The serial number specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

determinedProductCodeScheme.description: The actual product code scheme of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedProductCode.description: The actual product code of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedBatchId.description: The actual batch id of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedBatchExpiryDate.description: The actual batch expiry date of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedSerialNumber.description: The actual serial number of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

causeCategory.description: The root cause category assigned to this alert as determined by the root cause analysis.

causeCategoryDescription.description:
A human-readable description of the `causeCategory`. Note that this text can be defined by an administrator, with the
following consequences:

* The value can change at _any_ time.
* No length constraints can be given, clients must be ready to accept empty or very long texts.

Use the `Accept-Language` header to specify the desired language. Falls back to English when an unsupported language is
requested.

incidentId.description: The id of the incident this alert has been assigned to. Only set if a `causeCategory` has been assigned.

suspectedCauser.description: The _suspected causer_, as determined by a NAMS user. Legal values are currently `EMVS`, `END_USER` and `MAH`.

emvsMahId.description: Id of the responsible MAH in the EMVS.

obpId.description: Id of the responsible OBP in the EMVS.

obpStatus.description: Status of the responsible OBP in the EMVS.

productName.description: The name of the product the affected pack belongs to.

manualEntry.description: Flag indicating whether the alert-raising transaction was performed manually (i.e. by manually typing in the pack attributes) or not (i.e. by scanning the pack's DMC).

actualState.description: The status of the affected pack. Compare with `requestTargetState` in case of (undo) decommission errors.

marketId.description: The market id of the alert-raising transaction as specified by the European Hub.

givenNhrn.description: The **N**ational **H**ealthcare **R**eimbursement **N**umber specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

determinedNhrn.description: The actual **N**ational **H**ealthcare **R**eimbursement **N**umber of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

packLastUpdateLocation.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the `locationId` of the client of that previous transaction.

packLastUpdateTimestamp.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the time of that previous transaction.

packLastUpdateMarket.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the country code of the country where that previous transaction took place.

operation.description: Name/Id of the business process of the alert-raising transaction as given by the European Hub.

dueDate.description: Timestamp at which this alert must be processed by, specified by the AMS Hub, has no effect in NAMS.

clientSoftwareSupplier.description: Supplier of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

clientSoftwareName.description: Name of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

clientSoftwareVersion.description: Version of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

incidentTransitions.description: Incident transitions, describing the incidents this alert is/was assigned to (if any).

statusTransitions.description: Status transitions, describing the status this alert is/was in.

investigationStatusTransitions.description: Investigation status transitions, describing the investigation status this alert is/was in.

AlertDto.description: Full alert, extending `AlertOverviewDto` with transition records and details about the initiating user.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

sourceIncidentId.description: The id of the incident the alert was previously assigned to. `null` if this is the initial assignment.

targetIncidentId.description: The id of the incident the alert was assigned to after this transition.

AlertIncidentTransitionDto.description: A (re-)assignment of on alert from to an incident.

clientId.description: The user's _client id_, also called _login prefix_. Forms the full username when combined with `userId`.

userId.description: The user's _user id_. Forms the full username when combined with `clientId`.

regionCode.description: The region the user is assigned to (if configured in the NMVS). This is either the name of a single region, or a path of region names separated by `/`.

companyName.description: The name of the company the user is associated with.

AlertInitiatingUserInfoDto.description: Information about the user who caused an alert.

AlertInvestigationStatus.description: The possible investigation status a stakeholder group can assign to an alert.

AlertInvestigationStatusChangeRequestDto.description: Changes the investigation status of an alert.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

AlertInvestigationStatusTransitionDto.description: An alert's investigation status change. The `actor` attribute specifies the stakeholder group this transition refers to.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

modifiedBy.description: Username of NAMS user who most recently modified this record.

modifiedAt.description: The time at which this record was most recently modified.

fulfillingMarket.description: The country code of the country where the national system is located that escalated the alert. Can be equal to `initiatingMarket` if the alert-raising transaction was a local one, i.e. _not_ an inter-market transaction.

alertTimestamp.description: Timestamp at which the alert was raised.

escalationTimestamp.description: Timestamp at which the alert will be or would have been automatically escalated. Automatic escalation is performed when alerts are not being worked on by NAMS users.

givenProductCodeScheme.description: The product code scheme specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenProductCode.description: The product code specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenBatchId.description: The batch id specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenBatchExpiryDate.description: The batch expiry date specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

givenSerialNumber.description: The serial number specified by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

determinedProductCodeScheme.description: The actual product code scheme of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedProductCode.description: The actual product code of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedBatchId.description: The actual batch id of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedBatchExpiryDate.description: The actual batch expiry date of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

determinedSerialNumber.description: The actual serial number of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

* No length constraints can be given, clients must be ready to accept empty or very long texts.

Use the `Accept-Language` header to specify the desired language. Falls back to English when an unsupported language is

emvsMahId.description: Id of the responsible MAH in the EMVS.

obpId.description: Id of the responsible OBP in the EMVS.

obpStatus.description: Status of the responsible OBP in the EMVS.

productName.description: The name of the product the affected pack belongs to.

determinedNhrn.description: The actual **N**ational **H**ealthcare **R**eimbursement **N**umber of the affected pack as determined during the root cause analysis.

packLastUpdateLocation.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the `locationId` of the client of that previous transaction.

packLastUpdateTimestamp.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the time of that previous transaction.

packLastUpdateMarket.description: If the affected pack is known and has been (undo-)decommissioned before, the country code of the country where that previous transaction took place.

operation.description: Name/Id of the business process of the alert-raising transaction as given by the European Hub.

dueDate.description: Timestamp at which this alert must be processed by, specified by the AMS Hub, has no effect in NAMS.

clientSoftwareSupplier.description: Supplier of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

clientSoftwareName.description: Name of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

clientSoftwareVersion.description: Version of the software product used by the client in the alert-raising transaction.

AlertOverviewDto.description: Top-level alert attributes as returned by search operations. Does not contain transition records, query for specific alerts by `alertId` to obtain the full `AlertDto` specialization.

empty.description: Whether this page contains any items. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Check `content` directly.

size.description:
The _requested_ page size.
Deprecated, to be removed in v3 for being misleading: Use either the length of `content`, or the corresponding request's page size, depending on your use case.

number.description: The 0-based index of this page. If less than `totalPages - 1`, more pages of items are available.

numberOfElements.description: The number of items contained in this page. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Use the length of `content` instead.

totalElements.description: The total number of _items_ matched by the corresponding request. If greater than the length of `content`, this page represents only a subset of the available data.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages available for the requested page size and filters. `totalPages - 1` is the index of the last retrievable page.

first.description: Whether this page is the first one or not. Deprecated, to be removed in v3 in favor of `number == 0`.

last.description: Whether this page is the last one or not. Semantically identical to `number == totalPages - 1`.

AlertStatus.description: All possible status an alert can be in.

reasonCode.description: Reason code. Allowed values can be obtained via predefinition/reason endpoint.

customReasonText.description: Custom text. Required, when the custom reason code is used (RC-001). Otherwise not allowed.

AlertStatusChangeRequestDto.description: Changes the status of an alert.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

reasonCode.description: The reason code given for the status change. `null` for `targetStatus == 'UNDER_INVESTIGATION'`, otherwise required.

customReasonText.description: Reason text given for the status change. Set when the custom reason code is used (RC-001), `null` otherwise.

AlertTargetStatus.description: All possible status an alert can be transitioned into.

businessProcess.description: Name/Identifier of the _process_ that raised the alert. This value is defined by the national system.

errorCodeNs.description: Error code given by the national system, specifying the reason for the alert.

correlationIdRequestor.description: Correlation id given by the _client_ in the alert-raising transaction.

correlationIdNs.description: Correlation id given by the _national system_ in the alert-raising transaction.

AlertTransactionInformationDto.description: Information from a national system about the alert-raising transaction.

id.description: Unique identifier of this attachment. Used to retrieve a download URL pointing to the attachment's content.

filename.description: The filename associated with this attachment.

AttachmentDto.description: Represents a file attachment added to an alert. Use the `getAttachmentDownloadUri` operation to obtain a URI pointing to the attachment's content.

filename.description: The name of the file. The given extension must match the file content.

base64Binary.description: The base64-encoded content of the file. Must match the `filename`. At most 5MiB are allowed.

AttachmentInputDto.description: Uploads a file with a filename and base64-encoded content.

Audience.description: Stakeholder groups authorized to use a particular predefined code. `ALL` means that all stakeholder groups can use the predefined code.

alertIds.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

items.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

BulkAlertInvestigationStatusChangeReques.description: Changes the investigation status of multiple alerts at once.

alertIds.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

items.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

BulkAlertStatusChangeRequestDto.description: Changes the status of multiple alerts at once.

alertIds.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

items.description: The ids of the alerts to process. Duplicates will be ignored.

BulkCommentInputDto.description: Adds a comment to multiple alerts at once.

BulkProcessItemStatus.description:
The possible status an alert within a bulk process can be in.

| Status       | Description                                    |
|--------------|------------------------------------------------|
| `PENDING`    | The alert has not yet been processed.          |
| `SUCCESSFUL` | The alert has been processed successfully.     |
| `FAILED`     | The alert has not been processed successfully. |

alertId.description: The id of the processed alert.

failureReason.description: If the status is `FAILED`, may contain an error description.

BulkProcessItemStatusDto.description: The processing status of an individual item within a bulk process.

jobId.description: Unique identifier of this job. Must be given when requesting its results.

submittedAt.description: The time at which this job was originally submitted.

startedAt.description: The time at which this job has first started processing.

completedAt.description: If `SUCCESSFUL` or `FAILED`, the time at which the job has finished processing.

resultAvailableUntil.description:
If `SUCCESSFUL` or `FAILED`, the earliest time at which this job's results will be deleted.

Old job results are periodically deleted after some time. This attribute represents the time at which the result will be
_scheduled_ for deletion. _Actual_ deletion may happen a bit later.

numTotal.description: The total number of alerts to be processed.

numProcessed.description: The number of alerts that have already been processed, either successfully or not.

items.description:
The individual processing results for each alert. Only available for completed jobs and only for the same user that
submitted this job.

BulkProcessResultDto.description: Status information about a bulk job. For completed jobs (see `status`), individual results may be given in `items`.

BulkProcessStatus.description:
Represents the possible status a job can be in.

| Status       | Description                                                                                                                    |
|--------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `QUEUED`     | The job has been received and is waiting to be processed. A job can re-enter this status after a retryable processing failure. |
| `RUNNING`    | The job is currently being processed.                                                                                          |
| `SUCCESSFUL` | The job has finished and has successfully processed at least one alert.                                                        |
| `FAILED`     | The job has finished and failed to process any alert.                                                                          |

jobId.description: Unique identifier of this job. Must be given when requesting its results.

submittedAt.description: The time at which this job was originally submitted.

startedAt.description: The time at which this job has first started processing.

completedAt.description: If `SUCCESSFUL` or `FAILED`, the time at which the job has finished processing.

resultAvailableUntil.description:
If `SUCCESSFUL` or `FAILED`, the earliest time at which this job's results will be deleted.

Old job results are periodically deleted after some time. This attribute represents the time at which the result will be
_scheduled_ for deletion. _Actual_ deletion may happen a bit later.

BulkProcessStatusDto.description: Status information about a bulk job.

empty.description: Whether this page contains any items. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Check `content` directly.

size.description:
The _requested_ page size.
Deprecated, to be removed in v3 for being misleading: Use either the length of `content`, or the corresponding request's page size, depending on your use case.

number.description: The 0-based index of this page. If less than `totalPages - 1`, more pages of items are available.

first.description: Whether this page is the first one or not. Deprecated, to be removed in v3 in favor of `number == 0`.

last.description: Whether this page is the last one or not. Semantically identical to `number == totalPages - 1`.

numberOfElements.description: The number of items contained in this page. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Use the length of `content` instead.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages available for the requested page size and filters. `totalPages - 1` is the index of the last retrievable page.

totalElements.description: The total number of _items_ matched by the corresponding request. If greater than the length of `content`, this page represents only a subset of the available data.

BulkProcessType.description:
The supported bulk process types.

| Type                                | Description                                                  |
|-------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------|
| `CHANGE_ALERT_STATUS`               | The job changes the overall alert status of multiple alerts. |
| `CHANGE_ALERT_INVESTIGATION_STATUS` | The job changes the investigation status of multiple alerts. |
| `ADD_COMMENT`                       | The job adds a comment to multiple alerts.                   |

ClientOrganisationType.description: The _type_ of an organisation, also called _clients_ or _members_ in the NMVS context. These are groups of users.

createdBy.description: Username of NAMS user who created this record.

createdAt.description: The time at which this record was created.

messageCode.description: Message code specifying the content. `text` is specified as well when the message code indicates a custom message (MC-00001).

text.description: Custom text. Only set if `messageCode` == 'MC-00001', `null` otherwise.

nationalComment.description:
Defines whether this comment is a _national-only comment_.
National-only comments are _not_ synchronized with the AMS Hub and are only visible to users of _this_ NAMS instance.

attachments.description: Optional list of file attachments associated with this comment.

CommentDto.description: A comment that has been added to an alert.

empty.description: Whether this page contains any items. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Check `content` directly.

size.description:
The _requested_ page size.
Deprecated, to be removed in v3 for being misleading: Use either the length of `content`, or the corresponding request's page size, depending on your use case.

number.description: The 0-based index of this page. If less than `totalPages - 1`, more pages of items are available.

numberOfElements.description: The number of items contained in this page. Deprecated, to be removed in v3. Use the length of `content` instead.

totalElements.description: The total number of _items_ matched by the corresponding request. If greater than the length of `content`, this page represents only a subset of the available data.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages available for the requested page size and filters. `totalPages - 1` is the index of the last retrievable page.

first.description: Whether this page is the first one or not. Deprecated, to be removed in v3 in favor of `number == 0`.

last.description: Whether this page is the last one or not. Semantically identical to `number == totalPages - 1`.

messageCode.description: Message code. Allowed values can be obtained via predefinition/message endpoint. When custom text is indicated (MC-00001), `text` must be given as well.

text.description: Custom text. Required if and only if the custom message code is used (MC-00001).

nationalComment.description:
Defines whether the comment to create is a _national-only comment_.
National-only comments are _not_ synchronized with the AMS Hub and are only visible to users of _this_ NAMS instance.
This attribute is optional, its default value is `false`.

messageCode.description: Message code. Allowed values can be obtained via predefinition/message endpoint. When custom text is indicated (MC-00001), `text` must be given as well.

text.description: Custom text. Required if and only if the custom message code is used (MC-00001).

nationalComment.description:
Defines whether the comment to create is a _national-only comment_.
National-only comments are _not_ synchronized with the AMS Hub and are only visible to users of _this_ NAMS instance.
Adding `attachments` to national comments is _not_ allowed.
This attribute is optional, its default value is `false`.

attachments.description: At most 5 file attachments to be associated with this comment. _Must not_ be given if `nationalComment` is `true`.

CommentWithAttachmentsInputDto.description: Creates a comment with optional file attachments.

key.description: Attribute name to apply the condition to.

value.description: The value to be compared against the `key`. The comparison operator and thus the shape `value` is defined with `filterType`.

Filter.description: A filter condition. The choice of `key`, `value` and `filterType` must be valid. Otherwise the request will be rejected with HTTP 400.  Use the `getLegalFilters` operation to get a list of all allowed combinations.

filter.description: List of filter conditions. Can be empty/`null` to search without applying any conditions.

FilterRequestDto.description: Generic filter request object. Allows specifying search conditions, as well as paging and sorting.

FilterType.description:
A comparison operation used to define a filter condition. It specifies how a given `filterValue` is to be compared with the stored value
identified by the `filterKey`.

| Operator                    | Applicable Data Types | Description                                                                                |
|-----------------------------|-----------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `CONTAINS`                  | `String`              | Filter value must be a substring of the matched attribute.                                 |
| `CONTAINS_CASE_INSENSITIVE` | `String`              | Filter value must be a substring of the matched attribute, ignoring case.                  |
| `AFTER`                     | `date-time`           | Filter value is a timestamp and must be greated than or equal to the matched attribute.    |
| `BEFORE`                    | `date-time`           | Filter value is a timestamp and must be less than or equal to the matched attribute.       |
| `IS`                        | `String`              | Filter value must be equal to the matched attribute.                                       |
| `IS_CASE_INSENSITIVE`       | `String`              | Filter value must be equal to the matched attribute, ignoring case.                        |
| `NOT`                       | `String`              | Filter value must not be equal to the matched attribute.                                   |
| `IN`                        | Enum, `String`        | Filter value is a list of values, the matched attribute must be contained in the list.     |
| `NOT_IN`                    | Enum, `String`        | Filter value is a list of values, the matched attribute must not be contained in the list. |

HubInvestigationActor.description: The stakeholder groups that can change an alert's investigation status.

IntermarketTransactionType.description: The _type_ of an alert-raising transaction. Specifies the role of the national system from which the alert was imported.

sortKey.description: Attribute to sort results by, must be valid `key` as specified by the `getLegalFilters` operation.

offset.description: The 0-based index of the first item to return, equal to `pageNumber * pageSize`.

pageNumber.description: The 0-based index of the page to return.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page.

paged.description: Whether paging information was given, always `true`, because default page sizes and numbers are applied when not given in a request.

unpaged.description: Whether paging information was _not_ given, always `false`, because default page sizes and numbers are applied when not given in a request.

PageableObject.description: Page metadata of the _request_. Deprecated, to be removed in v3, use the values used at request time instead.

code.description: Unique representation of this predefined code.

text.description: The default human-readable translation of this predefined code as defined by the AMS Hub.

usable.description:
Indicates whether this predefined code can be used by the calling client, _or_ if the code is still registered at the AMS Hub.

If a predefined code is removed in the AMS Hub, this flag will switch to `false`, even if the calling client is included in the `audience`.
Attempting to use a predefined code in a request where `usable = false` will be rejected.

PredefinedMessageDto.description: Predefined message used when adding comments to an alert.

code.description: Unique representation of this predefined code.

text.description: The default human-readable translation of this predefined code as defined by the AMS Hub.

usable.description:
Indicates whether this predefined code can be used by the calling client, _or_ if the code is still registered at the AMS Hub.

If a predefined code is removed in the AMS Hub, this flag will switch to `false`, even if the calling client is included in the `audience`.
Attempting to use a predefined code in a request where `usable = false` will be rejected.

excludedStatuses.description: The target statuses this code can _not_ be used for in an alert status change request.

PredefinedReasonDto.description: Predefined reason used when changing the status of an alert.

empty.description: Whether a sort key was given (`false`) or not (`true`).

sorted.description: Whether a sort key was given (`true`) or not (`false`).

unsorted.description: Whether a sort key was given (`false`) or not (`true`).

SortObject.description: Sort metadata of the _request_. Deprecated, to be removed in v3, use the values used at request time instead.

alias.description: The name of the filter/sort key.

filterTypes.description: The filter types that are allowed to be used when filtering with `alias`.

SpecificationConfigValueDto.description: Specifies the filter types that can be used for a filter/sort key.

UserIntegrationType.description: A user's integration type, specifying the way in which the user connects to the NMVS.

traceIdType.description: Type of a `traceId` used to uniquely identify a request/response interaction.

Unauthenticated.description: Unauthenticated (invalid/missing credentials). Check the `WWW-Authenticate` response header for details.

X-NAMS-Trace-Id.description: Unique identifier assigned to an individual request/response interaction. Can be used for troubleshooting purposes.

scopes.location_id: An anonymous id that uniquely identifies your user across all connected systems.
scopes.region_code: The geographical region assigned to your NMVS client.
